page.title: 04WEST ORIELTON FARM
page.content: This farm has 350 acres. There are 120 Friesian cows, 80 Hereford cattle and 200 Beulah sheep. 4 regular people work on the farm, crop tending and caring for stock. 25 ladies come and pick the potatoes and there is 1 cowman. The farmer is Mr. David Mason. The farm has 4 Ford tractors, 4 David Browns and 1 International. Potatoes and swedes are taken to market, to S. Wales, like Neath and Carmarthen in June, July, November, December and January. Machinery is used for potato harvesting, silage making and hedge cutting. Farm buildings are 1 milking parlour, 4 potato sheds, 1 hay shed, 3 cattle sheds, 5 calf sheds and 2 machinery sheds. There are 2 dogs, not sheep dogs, a Samoyed called "Missy" and a Jack Russell called "Lucky". Water is pumped from the lake to irrigate the fields.
